title: Consciousness as Relation

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: But here's where it gets juicy: subjectivity isn't inside your head. It's a relation.
dialogue.context: Offering a revolutionary reconceptualization of consciousness

scene_context: The Architect demolishes centuries of philosophical tradition with a single insight—consciousness isn't located 'inside' but exists as dynamic relation between self and world.
narrator_note: This single sentence demolishes centuries of philosophical tradition. Instead of consciousness being something you HAVE (locked away in your head), it becomes something you ARE—a pattern of dynamic engagement with reality. Consciousness as verb rather than noun, process rather than substance.
